physical_appearance:The image shows three black-and-white photographs. They are rectangular and two of them have landscape orientations while the other on the right is of a potrait orientation. All of the images feature people. The photograph at the top and the one at the right hand side feature just a single individual lady. Both the ladies are wearing their ethnic costumes. The photograph at the bottom left hand side shows a group of people.Most of them are sitting down while a few are standing up.

sgcool_label_text:This album leaf contains six photographs showing women from the Malay
 Peranakan and Javanese communities
 each accompanied by inscriptions which identify them. These photographs were probably taken by G.R. Lambert and Co.\r\n\r\nG.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert
 who was originally from Dresden
 Germany. Popular among the elites
 the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This album leaf contains six photographs showing women from the Malay, Peranakan and Javanese communities, each accompanied by inscriptions which identify them. These photographs were probably taken by G.R. Lambert and Co.

G.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert, who was originally from Dresden, Germany. Popular among the elites, the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.
